name: LoreRim v4

perks.name: Craftsmanship
perks.description: You've acquired the basics of craftsmanship and know how to properly use all kinds of tools. You've also learned the material property of every weapon and thus they offer an extra effect.

perks.name: Advanced Blacksmithing
perks.description: You've gained quite some finesse, allowing you to craft plate armor and fine jewelry. You have also found a way to melt and crush certain gems into alchemically usable dust.

perks.name: Arcane Craftsmanship
perks.description: After studying Arcane Craftsmanship, you've learned the necessary techniques to craft bolts and arrows that will explode with elemental fury upon impact. (Requires 'Arcane Craftsmanship')

perks.name: Legendary Blacksmithing
perks.description: You make steel sing songs on the anvil. Your hammer is no longer a mere tool, but a loom that weaves the fabric of myths. You can even improve the divine artifacts of Aedra and Daedra.

perks.name: Advanced Light Armors
perks.description: You've been read An Introduction to Scale Armors, allowing you to craft and efficiently improve scale armor. (Requires 'An Introduction to Scale Armors')

perks.name: Elven Smithing
perks.description: You've gained enough finesse to create and improve Elven armor and weapons by studying the book 'About Elven Craftsmanship' (Requires 'About Elven Craftsmanship')

perks.name: Glass Smithing
perks.description: Crafting and improving Glass equipment is not for the unskilled, but having studied An Introduction to Malachite, you aren't one of them any more. (Requires 'An Introduction to Malachite')

perks.name: Dwarven Smithing
perks.description: You've read The Art of Dwarven Blacksmithing and acquired the secret knowledge of how to create and improve Dwarven equipment efficiently. (Requires 'The Art of Dwarven Blacksmithing')

perks.name: Orcish Smithing
perks.description: Orcish equipment is hard to craft, but you've got what it takes. By studying The Almanac of Orcish Blacksmithing, you can craft and improve it easily and most efficiently. (Requires 'The Almanac of Orcish Blacksmithing')

perks.name: Ebony Smithing
perks.description: Ebony weapons and armor - some even fail at heating the metal. But not you. Now that you've studied 'Harder than Steel - How to work with Ebony', you can craft and improve ebony equipment with ease. (Requires 'Harder than Steel - How to work with Ebony')

perks.name: Daedric Smithing
perks.description: The creation of daedric weapons and armor is a secret few mortals know - still, you managed to acquire this knowledge by reading Daedric Craftsmanship... (Requires 'Daedric Craftsmanship')

perks.name: Draconic Blacksmithing
perks.description: The scales and bones of dragons are probably the hardest material to work with, but you've mastered even this art since you studied The Compendium of Dragonic Armor. (Requires 'The Compendium of Draconic Armor')

perks.name: Conditioning
perks.description: You've accustomed yourself to using heavy armor. (No stamina drain for wearing heavy armor, unique bonus when wearing high-quality materials, -35% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Relentless Onslaught
perks.description: After extensive training you now can sprint in heavy armor without problems. (no sprinting stamina cost penalty, take 80% less melee damage when bullrushing, -10% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Devastating Tackle
perks.description: When in full heavy armor, you can cause devastating impact when bull-rushing. (Bull-rush while wearing 4 or more pieces of heavy armor does double damage and has higher chance to knockdown)

perks.name: Combat Casting
perks.description: You are able to keep concentrated enough in heavy armor. (No spell cost penalty for casting Novice and Apprentice spells in heavy armor)

perks.name: Combat Trance
perks.description: Your heavy armor distracts you even less. (No spell cost penalty for casting Adept spells in heavy armor)

perks.name: Combat Meditation
perks.description: You're accustomed to your heavy armor so much that you can now cast even sophisticated spells with relative ease. (No spell cost penalty for casting Expert spells in heavy armor)

perks.name: Battle Mage
perks.description: You have mastered spellcasting while wearing heavy armor. (No spell cost penalty for casting Master spells in heavy armor, 15% less spell cost when wearing all heavy armor: head, chest, hands, feet)

perks.name: Combat Training
perks.description: You are less hindered by your armor and can attack with ease. (No power attack stamina cost penalty, increased unarmed damage with heavy gauntlets, -10% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Immovable
perks.description: When in full heavy armor, you can pose a defensive stance to reduce incoming impact. (Resist physical, elemental and poise damage by 33% while attacking, casting, walking or standing still wearing 4 or more pieces of heavy armor)

perks.name: Fortitude
perks.description: Your training made you stronger and you are now less burdened by the rigidity of your armor. (+40 stamina, +20 carry weight, -10% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Power of the Combatant
perks.description: Taking hits gives you a rush of adrenaline. (Restore 15 stamina over 6 seconds after taking a hit, -10% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Juggernaut
perks.description: You've reached perfection in the skill of wearing heavy armor and are now significantly more maneuverable in it. (15% less armor weight, 10% more armor rating, 50% less poise damage when wearing all heavy armor: head, chest, hands, feet)

perks.name: Mounted Combat
perks.description: You can deal more damage with melee weapons while mounted. (1.5x melee attack damage while on horseback) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Improved Blocking
perks.description: You strengthened your shield arm and trained to parry blows a little. (Block 25% more damage with weapons and shields, take 25% less elemental damage when blocking with a shield and 10% less with a weapon)

perks.name: Experienced Blocking
perks.description: With weapon or shield you can block almost any blow with rock-solid confidence. (Block 50% more damage, recover some stamina when blocking a hit)

perks.name: Torch Combat
perks.description: You can use your torch more effectively in combat, causing painful burns. (Power bash with a torch does 10 extra fire damage and staggers the target, targets set on fire take 5 extra fire damage from weapon attacks)

perks.name: Strong Grip
perks.description: You hold on to your shield like you would hold on to your life. (50% less shield weight, 25% more armor rating, block 40% more damage, arrows that hit the shield do no damage)

perks.name: Elemental Protection
perks.description: You've learned how to block damaging spells more efficiently. (Take 50% less fire, frost, and shock damage when blocking with a shield)

perks.name: Defensive Stance
perks.description: You have honed your defensive movements to perfection. (Blocking with a shield does not slow you down, 75% less shield weight, 50% more armor rating)

perks.name: Powerful Bashes
perks.description: By gathering your strength for a short while, you can perform a much more powerful bash. (Able to do a power bash)

perks.name: Shield Strike
perks.description: You can use your shield more offensively, using it as a deadly weapon. (50% more shield bash damage, double damage when not wearing heavy armor, 25% less shield bash stamina cost)

perks.name: Shield Strike
perks.description: You can use your shield more offensively, using it as a deadly weapon. (100% more shield bash damage, double damage when not wearing heavy armor, 50% less shield bash stamina cost)

perks.name: Overpowering Bashes
perks.description: When you put all of your power into your shield bashes, you will often overpower your foes. (Power bashing with a shield can knock down)

perks.name: Disarming Bash
perks.description: You've trained in the art of disarming foes mid-combat. (20% chance to disarm when power bashing using a shield or weapon)

perks.name: Unstoppable Charge
perks.description: When bull rushing with your shield raised, you are a tremendous force to deal with. (Sprinting with a shield raised knocks down most targets and reduces incoming damage by 50%)

perks.name: Great Weapon Mastery
perks.description: Your improved fighting techniques increase your damage dealt with two-handed weapons. (20% more damage)

perks.name: Great Weapon Mastery
perks.description: Your improved fighting techniques increase your damage dealt with two-handed weapons even more. (40% more damage)

perks.name: Barbaric Might
perks.description: Your power attacks become mighty blows that will penetrate armor and are less tiring. (-30% power attack stamina cost, +30% armor penetration)

perks.name: Quarterstaff Focus
perks.description: You've learned the basics of quarterstaff combat. (Deal 10 stamina damage on-hit, +5% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Quarterstaff Focus
perks.description: You've acquired the advanced techniques of quarterstaff combat. (Deal 15 stamina damage on-hit, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Quarterstaff Focus
perks.description: You've become a master of quarterstaff combat. (Deal 20 stamina damage on-hit, +15% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Defensive Strike
perks.description: You can more efficiently block and parry incoming attacks with quarterstaves. (quarterstaves block 50% better, and bashes do twice the damage)

perks.name: Hafted Blade Focus
perks.description: You've become familiar with battle axes and halberds. (Attacks deal 40 extra damage over 20 seconds, +10% armor penetration)

perks.name: Hafted Blade Focus
perks.description: become an advanced battle axe and halberd fighter. (Attacks deal 60 extra damage over 20 seconds, +20% armor penetration)

perks.name: Hafted Blade Focus
perks.description: You've become a master of battle axe and halberd combat. (Attacks deal 80 extra damage over 20 seconds, +30% armor penetration)

perks.name: Shield Breaker
perks.description: Your mighty swings can cleave through target's defense, hindering them from blocking next attacks. (power attacks reduce target's blockable damage by 90% and stamina regeneration by 25% for 10 seconds)

perks.name: Longblade Focus
perks.description: You've acquired the advanced techniques of using greatswords and pikes. (Attacks reduce target's melee damage by 10% for 10 seconds, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Longblade Focus
perks.description: You've acquired the advanced techniques of using greatswords and pikes. (Attacks reduce target's melee damage by 15% for 10 seconds, +20% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Longblade Focus
perks.description: You've become a master of using greatswords and pikes. (Attacks reduce target's melee damage by 20% for 10 seconds, +30% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Reversal
perks.description: With enough momentum, you can slash deeper into targets with power attacks. (+25% critical hit chance and 2x critical hit damage when power attacking)

perks.name: Warhammer Focus
perks.description: You've learned some techniques to crush armor with warhammers. (+15% armor penetration, +5% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Warhammer Focus
perks.description: You've learned some techniques to crush armor with warhammers. (+30% armor penetration, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Warhammer Focus
perks.description: You've learned some techniques to crush armor with warhammers. (+45% armor penetration, +15% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Onslaught
perks.description: You can deliver maximum force with your warhammer to knock off targets that fail to resist. (power attacks with warhammers knock off targets by 10% chance, 25% more damage against staggered targets.)

perks.name: Devastating Charge
perks.description: You've learned to perform a leaping power attack while sprinting, reducing your enemies to smithereens. (Able to do sprinting power attack which has a 50% chance to critical hit)

perks.name: Devastating Strike
perks.description: Your two-handed combat style has improved so much that all power attacks have become devastating. (25% more power attack damage, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Hyper Armor
perks.description: Your power attacks are almost unstoppable. (Take 75% less poise damage while power attacking with two-handed weapons.)

perks.name: Mighty Strike
perks.description: You can fell almost any foe with a single strike of your two-hander. (50% more poise damage)

perks.name: Warbringer
perks.description: Your barbaric instincts strengthen as you or your foe meet their end. (Your power attacks deal up to 100% more damage based on the difference between your health and your target's health)

perks.name: Weapon Mastery
perks.description: Your improved fighting techniques allow you to swing one-handed weapons or fists with less effort and deal more damage. (20% more damage)

perks.name: Weapon Mastery
perks.description: Your improved fighting techniques increase your damage dealt with one-handed weapons or fists greatly. (40% more damage)

perks.name: Penetrating Strikes
perks.description: Your power attacks with one-handed weapons or fists are now devastating enough to penetrate enemy armor and less exhausting. (-30% power attack stamina cost, +30% armor penetration)

perks.name: Short Blade Focus
perks.description: You learned some dirty tricks for your dagger or tanto. (2x irresistible sneak attack damage, +20% damage from behind, +5% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Short Blade Focus
perks.description: A dagger or tanto in your hand turns into a deadly weapon. (3x irresistible sneak attack damage, +30% damage from behind, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Short Blade Focus
perks.description: You have mastered the deadly art of daggers and tantos. (4x irresistible sneak attack damage, +40% damage from behind, +15% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Puncture
perks.description: You can aim for critical weak points, dealing even more damage. (2x critical damage and +25% critical hit chance)

perks.name: War Axe Focus
perks.description: You've become familiar with war axes. (Attacks deal 20 extra damage over 20 seconds, +10% armor penetration)

perks.name: War Axe Focus
perks.description: You've become an advanced war axe fighter. (Attacks deal 30 extra damage over 20 seconds, +20% armor penetration)

perks.name: War Axe Focus
perks.description: You've become a master of war axe combat. (Attacks deal 40 extra damage over 20 seconds, +30% armor penetration)

perks.name: Armsbreaker
perks.description: The blade of your war axe can carve into target's weapons and shields, weakening their damage and protection. (power attacks with war axes reduce target's blockable damage by 80% and stamina regeneration by 25% for 10 seconds)

perks.name: Mace Focus
perks.description: You've learned some techniques to crush armor with maces. (10% more power attack damage, +15% armor penetration)

perks.name: Mace Focus
perks.description: You've become an advanced mace fighter and know how to find weak spots in enemy armor. (20% more power attack damage, +30% armor penetration)

perks.name: Mace Focus
perks.description: You've become a masterly mace fighter, rendering armor almost useless. (30% more power attack damage, +45% armor penetration)

perks.name: Stunning Blow
perks.description: You can cause stunning impact to targets that fail to block, knocking them down to the ground. (unblocked power attacks with maces knock down targets by 10% chance, 25% more damage against staggered targets)

perks.name: Sword & Spear Focus
perks.description: You've learned the basics of using 1 handed swords, spears, javelins, rapiers and katanas. (Attacks reduce target's melee damage by 10% for 10 seconds, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Sword & Spear Focus
perks.description: You've acquired the advanced techniques of using 1 handed swords and spears. (Attacks reduce target's melee damage by 15% for 10 seconds, +20% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Sword & Spear Focus
perks.description: You've become a master of using 1 handed swords and spears. (Attacks reduce target's melee damage by 20% for 10 seconds, +30% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Disarming Strike
perks.description: Your masterful strikes allow you to disarm enemies while attacking. (power attacks with swords, spears, javelins, rapiers and katanas disarm attacking targets by 15% chance)

perks.name: Powerful Charge
perks.description: You have learned to perform a leaping power attack while sprinting. (Able to do sprinting power attack which has a 50% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Powerful Strike
perks.description: You know how to put the maximum force into your power attacks. (20% more power attack damage, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Relentless Onslaught
perks.description: While attacking a target, build up momentum for a decisive strike. (Each normal attack with one-handed weapons increases power attack damage on target by 10% for 5s. Stacks up to six times - three while dual-wielding)

perks.name: Flurry
perks.description: When fighting with dual or single one-handed weapons or fists, you are able to hit enemy weak points better. (+15% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Flurry
perks.description: When fighting with dual or single one-handed weapons or fists, you're able to hit enemy weak points even better. (+30% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Storm of Steel
perks.description: You've mastered the art of using multiple weapons in combat. (50% more dual-wield power attack poise damage with any weapon, unlocks secondary dagger abilities when using a bow)

perks.name: Hand to Hand
perks.description: You are trained in hand to hand combat, and can effectively disable opponents with bare hands. (+25 unarmed damage, unarmed attacks damage target stamina by half the unarmed damage)

perks.name: Grappling
perks.description: You can grapple opponents to disarm or immobilize them. (unarmed power attacks stagger targets by 50% chance and disarm by 10% chance)

perks.name: Takedown
perks.description: You can knock down enemies by grappling. (unarmed power attacks knock down targets by 10% chance)

perks.name: Unarmed Defense
perks.description: You can defend yourself better even without weapons or shields. (15% less physical damage taken for each hand empty)

perks.name: Unarmed Stance
perks.description: While unarmed, you can maneuver more freely and resist physical force. (+5% movement speed for each hand empty, +50 mass when both hands are empty)

perks.name: Armed Spelllcasting
perks.description: You can balance your weapon well with a single hand, and can use it to cast magic. (+25% poise damage and 10% less spell cost when left hand is empty or wielding magic)

perks.name: Balanced Wielding
perks.description: You can balance your weapon better when wielding it in a single hand, delivering quick and precise attacks. (+25% damage against enemies who are attacking and +15% armor penetration when left hand is empty)

perks.name: Ranged Combat Training
perks.description: After some training at the shooting range you can deal more damage with ranged weapons. (20% more damage, ammunition grants armor penetration)

perks.name: Ranger
perks.description: You improved your footwork when engaging in ranged combat with light weapons. (Able to run with a drawn light bow or crossbow)

perks.name: Eagle Eye
perks.description: By concentrating only on your target and holding your breath, you can now aim much more precisely. (Zoom in by holding right mouse button)

perks.name: Marksman's Focus
perks.description: When fully focusing on your target, everything around you seems to slow down remarkably. (Time slows down while zooming, +10% critical hit chance)

perks.name: Rapid Reload
perks.description: Your have familiarized yourself with the mechanics of your crossbow. (+50% reload speed with heavy crossbows, +100% with light crossbows)

perks.name: Quick Shot
perks.description: You have learned to draw and fire in one single movement. (+50% draw speed with heavy bows, +100% with light bows)

perks.name: Power Shot
perks.description: You have discovered the art of aiming at tendons and joints. (Bows do 100% more poise damage, move forward and hold bash to perform power shot when over 200 stamina)

perks.name: Precise Aim
perks.description: Your aim is now precise enough to target weak spots in the enemy's defenses. (20% more damage)

perks.name: Piercing Shot
perks.description: You've learned how to hit the weakest parts of armor. (+50% armor penetration from ammunition)

perks.name: Penetrating Shot
perks.description: You've mastered the technique of hitting weak armor parts. (+50% armor penetration from ammunition)

perks.name: Stunning Precision
perks.description: Any successful staggering shot will almost always stun the target momentarily. (Staggering hits will also stun the target)

perks.name: Sniper
perks.description: You can keep steady aim with heavy ranged weapons, dealing more damage with sneak attacks. (1.5x irresistible sneak attack damage with heavy bow or crossbow)

perks.name: Bow Strike
perks.description: You can use your bow or crossbow as a melee weapon in close combat. (Double damage with bow bash, bow bash staggers targets, 50% less bow bash stamina cost)

perks.name: Knife Expertise
perks.description: Throwing knives penetrate the flesh, interrupting the target. (25% chance to stagger targets with throwing knives)

perks.name: Hunter
perks.description: You are more adapted to the wildlife, and better understand its inhabitants. (Do 20% more damage to animals and take 10% less damage from animals, +10% poison and disease resistance) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Hunter
perks.description: You are more adapted to the wildlife, and better understand its inhabitants. (Do 40% more damage to animals and take 20% less damage from animals, +20% poison and disease resistance) (Requires Level 20)

perks.name: Agility
perks.description: After some training you are now much more confident in your evasive movements. (25% less falling damage when wearing no heavy armor, unique bonus when wearing high-quality materials, -50% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Dodge
perks.description: Your trained reflexes allow you to dodge incoming blows. (Unlocks ability to dodge. Left alt by default.)

perks.name: Light Armor Training
perks.description: Up to 12% more power attack and ranged weapon damage when wearing no heavy armor.  25% more armor rating when wearing a low-tier light chestpiece (fur, hide, leather, etc) and no heavy armor.

perks.name: Dexterity
perks.description: You can balance your weapon and have unlocked dynamic bow dodging. (Up to 24% less power attack cost when wearing no heavy armor, press RMB when drawing a light bow to dodge, release left click to fire)

perks.name: Agile Spellcasting
perks.description: You learned how to avoid the limitations light armors bestow upon somatic spell components. (No spell cost penalty for casting spells in light armor)

perks.name: Wind Walker
perks.description: Your light armor and clothes have become your second skin. (Up to +10% movement speed when wearing no heavy armor: head, chest, hands, feet, -25% armor weight penalty)

perks.name: Vexing Flanker
perks.description: You have learned to flank your enemies with ease. (25% bonus damage when attacking from behind)

perks.name: Combat Reflexes
perks.description: You've gained the ability to act faster in combat, though doing so will quickly exhaust you. (Lesser power: Slow time by 50% for 10 seconds, drains 15 stamina per second)

perks.name: Meteoric Reflexes
perks.description: Your reflexes are lightning fast. (50% chance avoid physical damage when wearing no heavy armor: head, chest, hands, feet)

perks.name: Unarmored
perks.description: Having no weight on your body grants you extreme precision and reflexes. (20% chance to avoid physical damage, +5% movement speed and +10% armor penetration when not wearing armor)

perks.name: Stealth
perks.description: You know the basics of moving silently and are 30% harder to detect when sneaking while not wearing any heavy armor.

perks.name: Stealth
perks.description: You are 60% harder to detect when sneaking while not wearing any heavy armor.

perks.name: Deft Strike
perks.description: You've learned to exploit weaknesses in your foes' armor when sneak attacking with daggers, bows or swords.

perks.name: Anatomical Lore
perks.description: Newfound knowledge of humanoid anatomy allows you to slay almost any human-like creature outright with sneak attacks. (5x/2x sneak attack damage with melee/ranged weapons on humanoids, 2x/1.5x on targets immune to sneak attacks)

perks.name: Advanced Anatomical Lore
perks.description: Your vast knowledge of anatomy allows you to perform devastating sneak attacks on almost any target. (5x/2x sneak attack damage with melee/ranged weapons on all targets, 3x/2x on targets immune to sneak attacks)

perks.name: Muffled Movement
perks.description: Your newfound finesse allows you to move more quietly while not wearing any heavy armor.

perks.name: Light Steps
perks.description: By distributing your weight more consciously, you're able to move more freely while sneaking and avoid triggering pressure plates or similar mechanisms.

perks.name: Acrobatics
perks.description: Your improved balance allows you to silently roll forward, avoid getting knocked down except through magic and move even more quietly.

perks.name: Shadowrunner
perks.description: There's almost nothing you cannot evade. You are even harder to detect, more silent and all falling damage is decreased.

perks.name: Cheap Tricks
perks.description: You have learned the basics of the art of picking locks and carrying found goods. (+3 lockpicking expertise, +25 carry weight, forge lockpicks with Craftsmanship)

perks.name: Advanced Lockpicking
perks.description: You have extended your repertoire of lockpicking tricks and are able to carry more loot. (+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 carry weight)

perks.name: Treasure Hunter
perks.description: You are able to locate secret spaces in containers when you search them. (15% chance to find special loot in select chests)

perks.name: Sophisticated Lockpicking
perks.description: You have memorized the inner mechanics of sophisticated locks and security systems and are able to haul more loot out. (+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 Carry Weight)

perks.name: Masterly Lockpicking
perks.description: You learned everything there is to know about the art of lockpicking and hauling loot. (+2 Lockpicking Expertise, +25 Carry Weight, locks never break)

perks.name: Leader
perks.description: Nearby allies, but not the player, gain 150 armor rating and 15% magical resistance.

perks.name: Captain
perks.description: Allies, but not the player, regenerate health, stamina and magicka 50% faster.

perks.name: Commander
perks.description: Nearby allies, but not the player, gain 10% resist to fire, frost and shock.

perks.name: Legion
perks.description: Deal 10% more damage when you are fighting with allies.

perks.name: Lone Wolf
perks.description: Gain 15% magic resistance and 150 armor rating when fighting alone.

perks.name: Solo
perks.description: Regenerate health, stamina and magicka 50% faster when you are fighting alone.

perks.name: Maverick
perks.description: You resist 10% fire, frost and shock damage when fighting alone.

perks.name: One Man Legion
perks.description: Deal 10% more damage when you are fighting alone.

perks.name: Nimble Fingers
perks.description: You've spent some time improving your sleight of hand, which gives you substantial chances when pickpocketing.

perks.name: Nimble Fingers
perks.description: Your fingers have become very nimble, and besides other advantages, they allow you to   pickpocket even better and to apply poisons on your victims. Why fight if a vial of deadly venom can also do the trick?

perks.name: Cutpurse
perks.description: Pickpocketing gold, keys, gems and jewelry is 50% easier. Pickpocketing sleeping targets is much easier.

perks.name: Poisoner
perks.description: Poisons placed in targets' pockets are 50% stronger when target is not detecting you.

perks.name: Misdirection
perks.description: Can pickpocket equipped weapons, arrows and staves.

perks.name: Perfected Art
perks.description: Your legendary skill means you almost never get caught.  Poisons placed in pockets are 50% stronger on already poisoned targets.

perks.name: Sound Body
perks.description: You have unburdened your body. You gain 100 armor rating when not wearing armor and gain 10% armor penetration and 10 unarmed damage when unarmored.

perks.name: Sound Body
perks.description: You have unburdened your body. You gain 200 armor rating when not wearing armor and gain 20% armor penetration and 20 unarmed damage when unarmored.

perks.name: Sound Mind
perks.description: You've unburdened your inner thoughts, gaining 10% resistance to magic and 50% greater health, stamina and magicka regen when unarmored.

perks.name: Sound Spirit
perks.description: You have unburdened your spirit and now shouts are 10% stronger and last 10% longer also you are 25% more resistant to diseases and poisons when unarmored.

perks.name: Outlaw
perks.description: You've been in and out of jail, where most people wither away you've used the time to reflect and train Gain 5 Health, Magicka and Stamina per Jail Escapes, Up To 5 Times.

perks.name: Thief
perks.description: Gain carry weight, light armor rating and sneak ability per pocket picked, 10 carry weight, 2% light armor rating and 3% sneak ability per 20 pockets picked, maxing out at 100.

perks.name: Lucky 7
perks.description: You gain elemental resist based on how much gold you are currently carrying (Up to 21% Fire/Frost/Shock Resist, (3% per 5k gold, maxed at 35k))

perks.name: Trapper
perks.description: You can now pickup and deploy Bear Traps, and craft them yourself at the forge. Bear Traps deal extra damage based on your Finesse skill.

perks.name: Haggling
perks.description: You've learned how to deal with Skyrim's greedy merchants Prices are better and scale 1% per speech level.

perks.name: Merchant
perks.description: You can invest gold to permanently increase the amount of gold that merchants have, merchants will buy any non-stolen item, sell price is increased by 15%.

perks.name: Fencing
perks.description: You've become so persuasive that you could make almost anyone believe that your goods are of a legal origin.

perks.name: Silver   Tongue
perks.description: You've spent quite some time improving your rhetorical skills, intimidation is much more likely to succeed and you gain 10% better prices from the opposite gender.

perks.name: Leadership
perks.description: Your rhetorical skill makes you the perfect leader. By inspiring all those who fight by your side, followers gain 20% damage, -15% spell cost, +75% block, +100 magicka and stamina, 50 carry weight.

perks.name: Masquerade
perks.description: You've become proficient at acting, and with the right equipment you can now disguise yourself as a Forsworn, Imperial, Stormcloak, Necromancer, Thalmor or Warlock to (usually) avoid detection.

perks.name: Masquerade
perks.description: There is no role you cannot play, and your acting is so believable that there is almost no way for others to see through your disguises.

perks.name: War Cry
perks.description: Overwhelm your enemies with a roaring shout, striking fear into their hearts and sending weakner enemies fleeing. (living enemies up to level 30 do 20% less damage, enemies up to level 20 flee from combat for one minute)

perks.name: Commander
perks.description: Your knowledge in combat tactics allow you to effectively lead your allies in combat. (Improve nearby allies' skills by 10%, increase magicka, stamina, and their regeneration by 50(%), increase unarmed damage by 5)

perks.name: Commander
perks.description: Your knowledge in combat tactics allow you to effectively lead your allies in combat. (Improve nearby allies' skills by 20%, increase magicka, stamina, and their regeneration by 100(%), increase unarmed damage by 10)

perks.name: Commander
perks.description: Your knowledge in combat tactics allow you to effectively lead your allies in combat. (Improve nearby allies' skills by 30%, increase magicka, stamina, and their regeneration by 150(%), increase unarmed damage by 15)

perks.name: Lore of   the Thu'um
perks.description: You've been studying the lore and ancient script of dragons and the Thu'um. Thus, you can shout cooldown is reduced by 10%.

perks.name: Destructive   Urge
perks.description: The horrors that the Thu'um can inflict are etched into your mind just as you have seen them etched into stone. Your shouts have 15% greater magnitude.

perks.name: Indomitable Force
perks.description: You know what it means to be called Ysmir, Dragon of the North. Enemy shout effects are reduced by 50%.

perks.name: Spiritual Equilibrium
perks.description: You have been guided in meditating on the Thu'um. Now your shouts linger, lasting 15% longer than they did before.

perks.name: The Way of the Voice
perks.description: You've meditated thoroughly, and acquired vast insights into the Way of the Voice. Gain a daily power that lets you use your shouts more rapidly.

perks.name: Tongue's Insight
perks.description: You've spent time meditating on the Way of the Voice, unearthing more knowledge. Grants a dragon soul at the cost of a perk point.

perks.name: Shout Focus
perks.description: Your meditate on the Thu'um for deeper understanding of the Words of Power, making them more powerful. (Shouts are 5% more powerful, shout cooldown is reduced by 10%) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Shout Focus
perks.description: Your meditate on the Thu'um for deeper understanding of the Words of Power, making them more powerful. (Shouts are 10% more powerful, shout cooldown is reduced by 20%) [Requires Level 20]

perks.name: Shout Focus
perks.description: Your meditate on the Thu'um for deeper understanding of the Words of Power, making them more powerful. (Shouts are 15% more powerful, shout cooldown is reduced by 30%) [Requires Level 30]

perks.name: Alchemical Lore
perks.description: You've acquired basic alchemical insights and understand how to work with a laboratory. Thus, you can now craft your own potions and poisons.

perks.name: Alchemical Lore
perks.description: Through obscure knowledge, you now can enhance your mixtures and craft alchemistic powders at a smelter. Besides, your sensory organs have become very keen. Thus, you determine all the alchemical properties of consumed ingredients.

perks.name: Improved Elixirs
perks.description: Having refinined the brewing process, your potions are now 25% stronger.

perks.name: Night Vision
perks.description: Having altered your body with extracts from a sabrecat eye, you can now make your eyes see in the dark at will.

perks.name: Concentrated Poisons
perks.description: Your experience in the obscure alchemical arts allows you to concentrate your poisons. Thus, you can make most of them last longer before they need to be reapplied.

perks.name: Regeneration
perks.description: Having altered your body with extracts from troll fat, slaughterfish eggs and spriggan sap, you're now able to regenerate your body, and do so even more rapidly when you are immersed in water.

perks.name: Catalysis
perks.description: You've started experimenting with a catalyst that increases the yield of the brewing process.

perks.name: Catalysis
perks.description: You've perfected the catalyst. Thereby, you can craft double the amount of mixtures with the same amount of ingredients.

perks.name: Improved Poisons
perks.description: By adding small amounts of truly horrifying ingredients, you are able to make your poisons more potent.

perks.name: Immunization
perks.description: You've discovered a way to make your body more resiliant to disease and poison (50% and 25% respectively)

perks.name: Fortified Muscles
perks.description: Having altered your body with extracts from troll fat and a mammoth heart, you've become more resilient to harm.

perks.name: Alchemical Intellect
perks.description: Having altered your body with extracts from a Dremora's Heart and Ectoplasm, your mind has transcended mortal limits, expanding your magicka and improving your spell casting.

perks.name: Purification Process
perks.description: You've found a method to eliminate disadvantages from your mixtures and to make all of them even more potent.

perks.name: Drunken Combat
perks.description: Alcohol pumps you up, boosting your strength and stamina. (Removes Alcohol Blur, regenerate 2 stamina per second and do 10% more damage with melee attacks while tipsy) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Drunken Combat
perks.description: Alcohol pumps you up, boosting your strength and stamina. (Removes Alcohol Blur, regenerate 3 stamina per second and do 20% more damage with melee attacks while drunk) [Requires Level 20]

perks.name: Gourmet
perks.description: You keep a healthy diet, maximizing the nutrition of foods. (Food effects are 50% stronger and longer lasting) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Herbalist
perks.description: You can directly consume alchemical ingredients to draw their effects. (2x magnitude for ingredients consumed) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Herbalist
perks.description: You can directly consume alchemical ingredients to draw their effects. (5x magnitude for ingredients consumed) [Requires Level 20]

perks.name: Novice Illusion
perks.description: You've taught yourself a few Novice level spells and learned how to cast them with decreased effort while your newfound knowledge also allows you to augment the strength and duration of all Illusion spells.

perks.name: Apprentice Illusion
perks.description: By pursuing your apprenticeship in Illusion, you've gained knowledge of Apprentice level spells which you now augment while casting them with less effort.

perks.name: Adept Illusion
perks.description: By advancing further into the school of Illusion, you've gained some Adept level spells and learned how to augment and cast spells of this rank more easily.

perks.name: Expert Illusion
perks.description: You've unlocked almost every secret in the school of Illusion and you've acquired some Expert level spells. You can now cast spells of this level easier and augment them to an almost otherworldly extent.

perks.name: Master Illusion
perks.description: Your knowledge of Illusion has become all-encompassing. You taught yourself a Master level spell and you can cast the most complex spells from this school with less effort while augmenting them beyond mortal limits.

perks.name: Perceptual Illusions
perks.description: Perceptual illusion effects such as chameleon, dampen, hallucination, invisibility, muffle, night-eye, and sound are more effective and easier to cast. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for perceptual spells)

perks.name: Deceptive Image
perks.description: You can stack illusory image on yourself to deceive your enemies, making their attacks miss and expose their weak spots. (10% chance to take no physical damage and 20% chance to ignore 50% of enemy's armor rating while perceptual illusion spells are active)

perks.name: Environmental Manipulation
perks.description: Perceptual illusion spells are improved with additional effects. (improved effect for perceptual spells)

perks.name: Emotional Illusions
perks.description: Emotional illusion effects such as calm, charm, command, fear, frenzy, and rally are more effective and easier to cast. (increased success chance, 1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for emotional spells)

perks.name: Mesmerize
perks.description: Your emotional illusion spells seep deep into the targets' mind, further reducing their chance to break free. (increased success chance and 1.2x duration for emotional illusion spells)

perks.name: Domination
perks.description: Emotional illusion spells are improved with additional effects. (improved effect for emotional spells)

perks.name: Shadow Shaping
perks.description: Shadow magic effects such as sanctuary, shadow drain, shadow step, shadow stride, and shadow summon are more effective and easier to cast. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for shadow spells)

perks.name: Shadows of Conflict
perks.description: Draw power from forces in conflict, absorbing energy from nearby enemies and creating another reflection of shadow. (absorb 30% magicka regeneration from nearby enemies while shadow spells are active, +1 shadow summon limit)

perks.name: Master of Shadows
perks.description: Shadow illusion spells are improved with additional effects. Shadow summons last longer. (improved effect for shadow spells, 1.5x duration for shadow summon spells)

perks.name: Delusive Illusions
perks.description: Delusive illusion effects such as blind, death, nightmare, noise, pain, silence, and sleep are more effective and easier to cast. (increased success chance, 1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for delusive spells)

perks.name: Curse
perks.description: Curse your enemies with dark magic, weakening their body and soul. (1.1x physical damage, spell magnitude, and spell duration on targets under delusive illusion effects)

perks.name: Obliterate the Mind
perks.description: Delusive illusion spells are improved with additional effects. (improved effect for delusive spells)

perks.name: Empowered Illusion
perks.description: Dual casting an Illusion spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.

perks.name: Novice Conjuration
perks.description: You've taught yourself a few Novice level spells and learned how to cast them with decreased effort while your newfound knowledge also allows you to augment all Conjuration spells.

perks.name: Apprentice Conjuration
perks.description: By pursuing your apprenticeship in Conjuration, you've gained knowledge of Apprentice level spells which you now augment while casting them with less effort.

perks.name: Adept Conjuration
perks.description: By advancing further into the school of Conjuration, you've gained some Adept level spells and learned how to augment and cast spells of this rank more easily.

perks.name: Expert Conjuration
perks.description: You've unlocked almost every secret in the school of Conjuration and you've acquired some Expert level spells. You can now cast spells of this level easier and augment them to an almost otherworldly extent.

perks.name: Master Conjuration
perks.description: Your knowledge of Conjuration has become all-encompassing. You taught yourself a Master level spell and you can cast the most complex spells from this school with less effort while augmenting them beyond mortal limits.

perks.name: Mystic Binding
perks.description: You've become skilled in binding daedra in shape of weapons and armors. Bound weapons and armors are stronger longer-lasting, and easier to cast. (stronger bound items, 1.25x bound spell duration, 0.5x bound weapon spell cost)

perks.name: Mystic Infusion
perks.description: You can infuse bound weapons and armors with additional effects of your choice. Bound weapons and armors are easier to cast. (fire/frost/shock/mystic effect for weapons (damage), shield (cloak), and armor (resist), 0.9x bound item spell cost)

perks.name: Mystic Empowerment
perks.description: You can bind stronger or additional effects to your bound weapons and armors. Bound weapons and armors are more easier to cast and last longer. (improved bound effects, 1.5x bound spell duration (overwrite), 0.8x bound item spell cost (overwrite))

perks.name: Mystic Disruption
perks.description: You've perfected your invocations of summoning bound weapons and armors. Your bound weapons and armors are much stronger. (stronger bound items, weapon/shield/armor get increased armor penetration (20%) / damage blocked (20%) / physical damage reduction (10%))

perks.name: Necromancy
perks.description: You've developed your skill for summoning undead and rasing the dead, improving their potency and duration. (2x undead summon spell duration, stronger reanimated dead, 1.25x reanimate level limit, 5x reanimate spell duration)

perks.name: Ritualism
perks.description: Your knowledge of the realms of the dead surpasses that of many. You can raise stronger entities and they last much longer. (3x undead summon spell duration (overwrite), 1.5x reanimate level limit (overwrite), 10x reanimate spell duration (overwrite))

perks.name: Siphon Corpse
perks.description: You can violently drain remaining energy from corpses, destoying them in the process to damage nearby enemies. (Siphon Corpse lesser power: absorb 50 magicka from each corpse and deal 50 magical damage to nearby enemies, half damage to non-living)

perks.name: Dark Infusion
perks.description: By infusing your undead creations with dark energies, you can make them stronger and prevent them from decaying to dust. (stronger reanimated dead, reanimated dead can cast spells, reanimated dead do not turn into ash, 1.5x undead summon spell duration)

perks.name: Empowered Conjuration
perks.description: Dual casting a Conjuration spell overcharges the spell, allowing it to last longer.

perks.name: Cognitive Flexibility
perks.description: You have practiced the mental ability of maintaining two summons at the same time. This power extends to controlling any type of conjured or conceived entity, even outside the school of Conjuration.

perks.name: Cognitive Flexibility
perks.description: You have mastered the art of Cognitive Flexibility, a trait of only the most accomplished Summoners throughout history. You can now control three summons, of any type, simultaneously.

perks.name: Daedric Binding
perks.description: Having studied the barriers that divide the planes of existence, you can make your summoned daedra last longer in this realm. (2x daedra summon spell duration)

perks.name: Spiritual Binding
perks.description: Your knowledge of Oblivion's spiritual aspects increases the strength of all your summoned spirits.

perks.name: Gates of Oblivion
perks.description: You've perfected your spells' formulae to summon the daedra, maintaining them longer and can cast them further away. (3x daedra summon spell duration (overwrite), 3x daedra summon spell range)

perks.name: Dark Channeling
perks.description: You draw dark energy from the Oblivion realm while maintaining a connection to it, boosting your magicka regeneration. (+150% magicka regeneration while daedra summons are active)

perks.name: Waters of Oblivion
perks.description: Your knowledge of Oblivion's elemental aspects increases the strength of all your summoned Atronachs. Other daedra summons last longer. (stronger atronach summons, 1.5x non-atronach daedra summon spell duration)

perks.name: Spirit Calling
perks.description: You've learned to commune with the spirits, summoning them for extended duration. (2x spirit summon spell duration)

perks.name: Spiritual Bond
perks.description: You've strengthened your bond with the spirits. They can be summoned with much more ease and will last longer. (3x spirit summon spell duration (overwrite), 0.9x spirit summon spell cost)

perks.name: Spirit Guardian
perks.description: You can call upon the spirits to protect you, increasing your resistance to physical and magical attacks. (+10% magic resistance and +150 armor rating while spirit summons are active)

perks.name: Ancient Spirits
perks.description: You can call upon the ancient spirits for your aid. Summoned spirits are faster and stronger. (stronger spirit summons)

perks.name: Soul Magic
perks.description: Your training on Soul Magic allows you to channel more strength with higher efficiency. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for necrotic and soul spells)

perks.name: Necropotence
perks.description: Your necrotic spell consumes all, burning the soul of the living and damaging even the non-living. (25% stagger chance when dual-casted, extra damage over time to the living, half damage to non-living)

perks.name: Novice Destruction
perks.description: You've taught yourself a few Novice level spells and learned how to cast them with decreased effort while your newfound knowledge also allows you to augment all Destruction spells.

perks.name: Apprentice Destruction
perks.description: By pursuing your apprenticeship in Destruction, you've gained knowledge of Apprentice level spells which you now augment while casting them with less effort.

perks.name: Adept Destruction
perks.description: By advancing further into the school of Destruction, you've gained some Adept level spells and learned how to augment and cast spells of this rank more easily.

perks.name: Expert Destruction
perks.description: You've unlocked almost every secret in the school of Destruction and you've acquired some Expert level spells. You can now cast spells of this level easier and augment them to an almost otherworldly extent.

perks.name: Master Destruction
perks.description: Your knowledge of Destruction has become all-encompassing. You taught yourself a Master level spell and you can cast the most complex spells from this school with less effort while augmenting them beyond mortal limits.

perks.name: Improved Cloaks
perks.description: You can radiate more energy with cloak spells, increasing their damage greatly. (1.5x cloak spell damage)

perks.name: Elemental Mastery
perks.description: Unlock the power of elemental seals. Cast Fire, Frost, and Lightning Seals at your feet, each creating a deadly trap that triggers when enemies approach. All three seals can be active simultaneously.

perks.name: Destructive Blow
perks.description: You can deliver powerful force with touch and nova spells, causing more damage and staggering targets. (1.25x magnitude for touch and nova spells, 25% chance to stagger for damaging touch and nova spells)

perks.name: Empowered Destruction
perks.description: Dual casting a Destruction spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.

perks.name: Impact
perks.description: By intensifying the force of most of your overcharged Destruction spells, you're now capable of staggering your foes. (25% chance to stagger when dual-casted)

perks.name: Blood Magic
perks.description: You can more efficiently absorb energy from targets. Absorb spells are more powerful and costs less magicka. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for absorb spells)

perks.name: Blood Magic
perks.description: You can absorb even more energy from targets with greater efficiency. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for absorb spells)

perks.name: Consume Life
perks.description: You can absorb much more health from living targets. (1.25x magnitude for absorb health spells on living targets)

perks.name: Entropic Focus
perks.description: You now are able to improve your Entropic spells and thereby increase their effectiveness. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for entropic spells)

perks.name: Entropic Focus
perks.description: Your Entropic spells are more powerful and you can cast them more efficiently. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for entropic spells)

perks.name: Entropic Disarray
perks.description: Your Entropic spells drain all energy from targets, damaging Magicka and Stamina by same amount. (magicka and stamina damage for entropic spells)

perks.name: Arcane Focus
perks.description: You now are able to improve your Arcane spells and thereby increase their effectiveness. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for arcane spells)

perks.name: Arcane Focus
perks.description: Your Arcane spells are more powerful and you can cast them more efficiently. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for arcane spells)

perks.name: Arcane Disruption
perks.description: You can imbue more magical energy to arcane spells, dealing more damage to enemies that are not resistant to magic. (arcane spells do more damage to enemies with low magic resistance)

perks.name: Pyromancy
perks.description: You now are able to intensify the heat of your fire spells. Thus, they now deal increased damage. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for fire spells)

perks.name: Pyromancy
perks.description: Your fire spells burn with almost otherworldly heat and consume earth and flesh with terrifying ease. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for fire spells)

perks.name: Cremation
perks.description: Enemies are set on fire for extended duration, taking extra damage over time. (extra damage over time for fire spells)

perks.name: Fire Mastery
perks.description: Your mastery of fire element grants you resistance to fire and increased efficiency of fire spells. (+25% fire resistance, 1.05x magnitude, 0.9x cost for fire spells)

perks.name: Cyromancy
perks.description: You now are able to improve your ice spells and thereby increase their effectiveness. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for frost spells)

perks.name: Cyromancy
perks.description: Your ice spells freeze even air in a trice and make the harsh winters of Skyrim look like a refreshing breeze. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for frost spells)

perks.name: Deep Freeze
perks.description: Your frost spells render targets more susceptible to frost, and freezes enemies with low resistance to frost or magic. (freeze effect for frost spells, frost spells temporarily reduce target's frost resistance by 10% if not immune)

perks.name: Frost Mastery
perks.description: Your mastery of frost element grants you resistance to frost and increased efficiency of frost spells. (+25% frost resistance, 1.05x magnitude, 0.9x cost for frost spells)

perks.name: Electromancy
perks.description: You can now energize your lightning spells more effectively, causing them to deal more damage. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for shock spells)

perks.name: Electromancy
perks.description: Compared to your lightning spells, the worst tempests would look like a mild summer breeze. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for shock spells)

perks.name: Electrostatic Discharge
perks.description: Lightning spells deplete targets' magicka and staggers enemies with low resistance to shock or magic. (Magicka damage and stagger for shock spells)

perks.name: Lightning Mastery
perks.description: Your mastery of lightning element grants you resistance to shock and increased efficiency of lightning spells. (+25% shock resistance, 1.05x magnitude, 0.9x cost for shock spells)

perks.name: Painful Regrets
perks.description: You've honestly reflected your sins, and you truly regret what pain you have inflicted upon others. All spells cost 10% less but buying/selling prices are much higher.

perks.name: Novice Restoration
perks.description: You've taught yourself a few Novice level spells and learned how to cast them with decreased effort while your newfound knowledge also allows you to augment all Restoration spells.

perks.name: Apprentice Restoration
perks.description: By pursuing your apprenticeship in Restoration, you've gained knowledge of Apprentice level spells which you now augment while casting them with less effort.

perks.name: Adept Restoration
perks.description: By advancing further into the school of Restoration, you've gained some Adept level spells and learned how to augment and cast spells of this rank more easily.

perks.name: Expert Restoration
perks.description: You've unlocked almost every secret in the school of Restoration and you've acquired some Expert level spells. You can now cast spells of this level easier and augment them to an almost otherworldly extent.

perks.name: Master Restoration
perks.description: Your knowledge of Restoration has become all-encompassing.You taught yourself a Master level spell and you can cast the most complex spells from this school with less effort while augmenting them beyond mortal limits.

perks.name: Empowered Restoration
perks.description: Dual casting a Restoration spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.

perks.name: Focused Mind
perks.description: You've learned to focus your mind. Thus, you can keep your concentration even in stressful situations and regenerate your magicka faster. (+50% magicka regeneration)

perks.name: Power of Life
perks.description: Your studies of healing magic now grant you the power of making yourself almost invulnerable for a short duration once a day.

perks.name: Essence of Life
perks.description: Your understanding of healing and how magic and life are intertwined allows you to call upon your newfound power more often.

perks.name: Improved Protection
perks.description: Ward, Fortify, and Resist spells are stonger and more efficient. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for protection spells)

perks.name: Improved Wards
perks.description: Your arcane wards now absorb magicka from incoming spells and have improved efficiency. (25% ward spell absorption, 0.9x ward spell cost)

perks.name: Ward Mastery
perks.description: You are more proficient with ward spells, using them more efficiently to block magic. (Ward spells cost 50% less magicka, +10% magic resistance when holding Ward spell in hand)

perks.name: Improved Healing
perks.description: You've gained more knowledge about healing spells, allowing you to heal wounds more efficiently. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for healing and cure spells)

perks.name: Respite
perks.description: In addition to curing wounds, your healing spells now reinvigorate the body itself, restoring subject's stamina. (healing spells restore stamina by 0.5x of healing done)

perks.name: Improved Turning
perks.description: Turn, Purify, and Abjuration spells are stonger and more efficient. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for turn spells)

perks.name: Mystic Turning
perks.description: You've learned the art of weaving mystical energies into your spells, making all of them more effective against the undead and Daedra. (1.1x spell magnitude, 1.2x spell duration on undead and daedra)

perks.name: Heliomancy
perks.description: You now are able to improve your sun spells and thereby increase their effectiveness. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for sun spells)

perks.name: Scorching Light
perks.description: Your sun spells are infused with radiant energy, dealing more damage to undead and even damage the living. (25% stagger chance when dual-casted, extra damage over time to undead, sun spells that only work on undead now deal half damage to living)

perks.name: Venomancy
perks.description: You now are able to improve your poison spells and thereby increase their effectiveness. (1.1x magnitude, 0.9x cost for poison spells)

perks.name: Paralyzing Poison
perks.description: Your poison spells are much more potent, rendering targets more susceptible to poison and paralyzing those with low resistance to poison or magic. (paralysis effect for poison spells, poison spells temporarily reduce target's poison resistance by 10% if not immune)

perks.name: Novice Alteration
perks.description: You've taught yourself a few Novice level spells and learned how to cast them with decreased effort while your newfound knowledge also allows you to augment all Alteration spells.

perks.name: Apprentice Alteration
perks.description: By pursuing your apprenticeship in Alteration, you've gained knowledge of Apprentice level spells which you now augment while casting them with less effort.

perks.name: Adept Alteration
perks.description: By advancing further into the school of Alteration, you've gained some Adept level spells and learned how to augment and cast spells of this rank more easily.

perks.name: Expert Alteration
perks.description: You've unlocked almost every secret in the school of Alteration and you've acquired some Expert level spells. You can now cast spells of this level easier and augment them to an almost otherworldly extent.

perks.name: Master Alteration
perks.description: Your knowledge of Alteration has become all-encompassing. You taught yourself a Master level spell and you can cast the most complex spells from this school with less effort while augmenting them beyond mortal limits.

perks.name: Transmutation
perks.description: Transmutation, size-shifting, shape-shifting spells are stonger and more efficient. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration, 0.9x cost for transmutation spells)

perks.name: Transmutational Mending
perks.description: Health is increased and regenerates while transmutation spell is active. (+50 health and +1/s health regeneration while transmutation spell is active)

perks.name: Empowered Alterations
perks.description: Dual casting an Alteration spell overcharges the effects into an even more powerful version.

perks.name: Kinetomancy
perks.description: You can more easily handle telekinetic spells, increasing their power and efficiency. (1.2x magnitude, 0.8x cost for telekinetic spells)

perks.name: Power of the Force
perks.description: Your telekinetic spells cause devastating impact, dealing more damage and knocking off stronger targets. (+25% physical telekinetic spell damage, +10% magic resistance threshold for telekinetic knockdown effect)

perks.name: Improved Mage Armor
perks.description: You've mastered the art of casting armor spells. Their effect is maximized when you don't wear any distracting armor. (1.5x armor and shield spell magnitude when not wearing chest armor, 1.2x when wearing chest armor)

perks.name: Versatile Armor
perks.description: You've expanded the versatility of your Armor and Shield spells, enabling them to decrease incoming elemental and physical damage. (0.8x incoming fire, frost, shock, physical damage when Armor or Shield spell is active)

perks.name: Magic Resistance
perks.description: You're able to block a part of a dangerous spell's effect. (+10% magic resistance)

perks.name: Magic Resistance
perks.description: You are able to block more of a dangerous spell's effect. (+20% magic resistance)

perks.name: Magic Resistance
perks.description: You are able to block even more of a dangerous spell's effect. (+30% magic resistance)

perks.name: Stability
perks.description: You've become exceptionally good at making your alteration spells more stable. Thus, they now last longer. (1.5x alteration spell duration)

perks.name: Metamagical Thesis
perks.description: Your knowledge of the very fabric of magic itself allows you to cast any spell of any school with decreased effort. (0.9x spell cost for all schools of magic)

perks.name: Metamagical Empowerment
perks.description: Having delved even deeper in metamagical lore, you can cast any spell more effectively and augment all other magical effects. (1.1x magnitude, 1.1x duration for all schools of magic)

perks.name: Weather Magic
perks.description: Wind spells are stronger and more efficient. (1.2x magnitude, 1.2x duration, 0.8x cost for wind spells)

perks.name: Master of Storms
perks.description: Wind spells are more devastating at exteriors, and you can summon a thunderstorm with Control Weather spell. (1.33x wind spell magnitude at exteriors, can choose Storm weather with Control Weather spell)

perks.name: Magical Absorption
perks.description: You've mastered the art of absorbing Magicka from incoming spells, and are now able to fully absorb their power from time to time. (+10% magic absorb chance)

perks.name: Unskilled Spellcasting
perks.description: You can cast simple spells without mastering them but with less potency. (Spells up to Novice level cost 50% less magicka to cast without mastery perks)

perks.name: Unskilled Spellcasting
perks.description: You can cast simple spells without mastering them but with less potency. (Spells up to Apprentice level cost 50% less magicka to cast without mastery perks, +0.5% spell power for each skill level) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Unskilled Spellcasting
perks.description: You can cast simple spells without mastering them but with less potency. (Spells up to Adept level cost 50% less magicka to cast without mastery perks, +1% spell power for each skill level) [Requires Level 20]

perks.name: Metamagic
perks.description: You can empower your spells in cost of more Magicka to cast them. (Apply one of the three bonuses with 50% more magicka cost: 20% higher magnitude, 20% longer duration, 3x longer spell range) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Willpower
perks.description: Your strong willpower provides resistance to harmful magic and more stamina. (+5% magic resistance when Magic Resistance perk is not taken, +10 stamina) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Willpower
perks.description: Your strong willpower provides resistance to harmful magic and more stamina. (+10% magic resistance when Magic Resistance perk is not taken, +20 stamina) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Willpower
perks.description: Your strong willpower provides resistance to harmful magic and more stamina. (+15% magic resistance when Magic Resistance perk is not taken, +30 stamina) [Requires Level 10]

perks.name: Enchanter's Insight
perks.description: You've acquired fundamental insights into how matter and magic intertwine. (new enchantments are 25% stronger, craft novice level staves and scrolls, can recharge weapons)

perks.name: Enchanter's Insight
perks.description: Your advanced knowledge of arcane energy allows you to improve all your enchantments even more. (new enchantments are 50% stronger, craft novice level staves and scrolls)

perks.name: Arcane Artificery
perks.description: Your understanding of enchantments allow you to use them more effectively and efficiently. (Staves and Scrolls are 10% more powerful, enchantments cost 10% less charges)

perks.name: Arcane Artificery
perks.description: Your understanding of enchantments allow you to use them more effectively and efficiently. (Staves and Scrolls are 20% more powerful, enchantments cost 20% less charges)

perks.name: Arcane Artificery
perks.description: Your understanding of enchantments allow you to use them more effectively and efficiently. (Staves and Scrolls are 30% more powerful, enchantments cost 30% less charges)

perks.name: Soul Gem Mastery
perks.description: You've learned how to draw more energy from soul gems and are now able to craft them at a smelter by transmuting and melting certain minerals. (+50% charge from soul gems, craft soul gems and apprentice level staves and scrolls)

perks.name: Arcane Experimentation
perks.description: Your studies have enabled you to research unique enchantments of your own and to craft better staves at the forge. (new enchantments are 20% stronger, learn five new enchantments with Arcane Experimentation power, craft adept level staves and scrolls)

perks.name: Artificer's Insight
perks.description: You could fill grimoires with your newfound knowledge that allows you to create even better enchantments and staves. (new enchantments are 25% stronger, learn five new enchantments with Artificer's Insight power, craft expert level staves and scrolls)

perks.name: Elemental Lore
perks.description: You've learned how to tame the elements most efficiently. Thus, all elemental enchantments are stronger. (new elemental enchantments are 50% stronger, you can craft runestones and create runestone enchantments)

perks.name: Corpus Lore
perks.description: You've become skilled in using enchantments to strengthen mind and body. Thus, all such enchantments are stronger. (new attribute enchantments are 50% stronger and you can make more advanced runestone enchantments)

perks.name: Skill Lore
perks.description: You've become a master of infusing enchantments that transfer knowledge and skill to the user, making all such ones stronger. (new skill enchantments are 50% stronger, Ebony Smiths can permanently imbue unique enchantments onto their weapons)

perks.name: Enchantment Mastery
perks.description: You've found a way to bind even more energy into inanimate matter. (new enchantments are 10% stronger, can place two enchantments with 60% strength each, craft master level staves and scrolls, 0.8x staff charge cost)

perks.name: Artifact Enchanter
perks.description: With great skill and dedication, you get a chance to enchant an item with extraordinary strength. (enchant one item with twice the strength, can place three enchantments with 50% strength each)

perks.name: Destiny
perks.description: Increases carry weight by 25.

perks.name: Focus
perks.description: Your Magicka Regeneration is increased by 50%

perks.name: Constitution
perks.description: Your Health Regeneration is increased by 50%

perks.name: Endurance
perks.description: Your Stamina Regeneration is increased by 50%

perks.name: Mage
perks.description: Your spells and enchantments cost 5% less Magicka

perks.name: Warrior
perks.description: You deal 5% more weapon damage

perks.name: Thief
perks.description: You are 10% harder to detect

perks.name: Fortification
perks.description: Your Health, Magicka and Stamina are increased by 10

perks.name: Magicka Surge
perks.description: Your Magicka Regeneration is increased by 400% when your Magicka falls below 25%

perks.name: Magicka Shell
perks.description: Your magic resistance is increased by 10%

perks.name: Iron Skin
perks.description: Every 10 seconds, taking damage increases your Armor Rating by 150 for 6 seconds

perks.name: Battle Spirit
perks.description: Power attacks increase your attack damage by 10% for 6 seconds

perks.name: Adrenaline
perks.description: Your Stamina Regeneration is increased by 200% when your Stamina falls below 25%

perks.name: Swiftness
perks.description: Every 10 seconds, taking damage increases your movement speed by 20% for 6 seconds

perks.name: Agent
perks.description: Enemy attacks against you slows them by 25% for 5 seconds

perks.name: Sorcerer
perks.description: You take 10% less damage while casting spells

perks.name: Spellsword
perks.description: You restore 15 magicka per weapon attack

perks.name: Knight
perks.description: You take 10% less damage while power attacking, drawing a bow, or blocking

perks.name: Endurance
perks.description: You regenerate stamina 100% faster

perks.name: Scout
perks.description: Your bows, crossbows and throwing knives do 10% more damage.

perks.name: Spellblade
perks.description: Attacks with weapons have a 30% chance to interrupt casting enemies

perks.name: Leadership
perks.description: Nearby allies move 15% faster during combat

perks.name: Hard Skin
perks.description: Your Armor Rating is increased by 100

perks.name: Healing Presence
perks.description: You heal yourself and nearby allies for 10 Health every 10 seconds

perks.name: Absorption
perks.description: You have a 10% chance to absorb the Magicka from incoming spells

perks.name: Conjuring Presence
perks.description: Nearby summoned or reanimated allies have 50 increased Health,, 50 increases Armor Rating and reflect 15% physical damage

perks.name: Corrosive Weapon
perks.description: Power attacks reduces enemies magic resistance by 15% and Armor Rating by 75 for 10 seconds

perks.name: Leeching Strikes
perks.description: You absorb 15 Health over 3 seconds from enemies attacking you once every 10 seconds for each enemy. While below 25% Health, absorbed Health is doubled

perks.name: Unyielding
perks.description: While blocking, your health, stamina and magicka regeneration are increased by 25%

perks.name: Overwhelming Presence
perks.description: Close enemies have 100 reduced Armor Rating

perks.name: Smash
perks.description: Power attacks deal 10% more damage

perks.name: Trickster
perks.description: You have a 10% chance to evade enemy weapon attacks

perks.name: Swift Shadow
perks.description: You move 20% faster while sneaking

perks.name: Viper's Blade
perks.description: Power attacks reduces enemies poison resistance by 50% for 10 seconds

perks.name: Evasion
perks.description: You have a 15% chance to evade spells

perks.name: Silent Blade
perks.description: Your attacks deal 25 damage to Magicka

perks.name: Bard
perks.description: Nearby allies deal 15% more physical damage and have 15% magic resistance during combat

perks.name: Shaman
perks.description: You deal 20% more damage against impaired enemies

perks.name: Templar
perks.description: Every 90 seconds, falling below 10% Health, you are immune to any damage for 6 seconds and heal yourself afterwards for 100 Health

perks.name: Archmage
perks.description: Your Spells are 15% stronger or last 30% longer

perks.name: Summoner
perks.description: You can summon or reanimate one additional minion

perks.name: Battlemage
perks.description: Power attacks cost 25% less stamina if you have a spell in your left hand. Spell & enchantment cost 10% less if you have a weapon in your right hand

perks.name: Blood Knight
perks.description: While above 50% Health you deal 10% more weapon damage and while below 50% Health, you take 25% less magic damage

perks.name: General
perks.description: Your weapon damage and Armor Rating is increased by 10%

perks.name: Monk
perks.description: Your attacks deal 50 bleeding damage over 5 seconds

perks.name: Berserker
perks.description: You take 25% less damage while power attacking and power attack stamina usage is reduced by 20%

perks.name: Saboteur
perks.description: Your attacks have a 15% chance to stagger enemies. You deal 25% more damage against staggered enemies

perks.name: Assassin
perks.description: Every 10 seconds, your next attack deals 100% more damage

perks.name: Rogue
perks.description: Your attacks deal 50 poison damage over 10 seconds

perks.name: Stalker
perks.description: Your attacks slows enemies by 50% for 3 seconds

perks.name: Nightblade
perks.description: Against enemies that are out of Magicka, your attacks deal 20% more damage and have a 30% chance to dispel magic

perks.name: Addict
perks.description: You've developed some bad habits. Skooma and alcohol benefits last 2x as long and you can craft skooma at cooking pot. When not under the effects of alcohol or skooma, you have a 25% chance to get staggered when hit.

perks.name: Adrenaline   Rush
perks.description: You possess a natural flight response. When at less than 20% health, you move 20% faster and regenerate 1 stamina per second but also deal 30% less damage when below this threshold.

perks.name: Au   Naturel
perks.description: Embrace your divine gifts! Start with +100 health, magicka, and stamina. For each piece of armor or clothing you wear, you lose 40 from each attribute (up to a maximum loss of -160 with four pieces equipped). Additionally, you gain +1 to health, magicka, and stamina per level for each empty armor slot (head, chest, hands, and feet).

perks.name: Bad   Natured
perks.description: You were born into wickedness. Your attacks while being crouched deals 20% more and you're better at pickpocketing. However, attacks while standing up do 20% less and wearing a divine amulet will hurt you.

perks.name: Bane of   the Wicked
perks.description: You are an enemy to all things abhorrent. Deal 20% more damage to undead, daedra and werewolves. However, do 10% less damage to other beings.

perks.name: Bulwark
perks.description: When walking or standing still, you gain 200 armor rating and reflect 10% physical damage. You drain 1 additional stamina per second while sprinting and 0.25 when running.

perks.name: Defiler
perks.description: The only use you have for the living is to resurrect them in death. Deal 20% more damage to playable races. However, do 10% less damage to other beings.

perks.name: Disciplined
perks.description: Shoot to kill. Bows and crossbows deal 20% more damage. However, they draw/reload 40% slower.

perks.name: Dovah   Tinvaak
perks.description: You are fluent in Dragon speech and as such can shout 10% more often, at 20% reduced effectiveness.

perks.name: Elemental   Conduit
perks.description:
Fire spells are more powerful in sunny weather but lose potency in the rain.
Shock spells are enhanced during rain but are less effective in snowy conditions.
Frost spells excel in snowy weather but weaken under sunny skies.

perks.name: Fast   Shot
perks.description: You'd rather shoot fast than shoot hard. Bows draw 40% faster, crossbows reload 40% faster. However, bows and crossbows deal 30% less damage.

perks.name: Focused
perks.description: When in danger, you think before acting. When at less than 20% health, you regenerate 5 magicka per second and absorb 10% of incoming spells. However, you take 10% more damage when below this threshold.

perks.name: Gambler
perks.description: You go in all or nothing. Gain 50% chance to critical hit. However, overall weapon damage is reduced by 40%. When you land a critical hit, your attacks do 10% more damage for 30 seconds (stackable up to 5 times).

perks.name: Giantkin
perks.description: Descended from the mighty giants; you gain 10% magic resistance and damage with blunt weapons, however you cannot read skill books, or use scrolls and staves.

perks.name: Glutton
perks.description: You LOVE food but hate medicine. Food benefits are 25% stronger but potions have only 50% their efficiency.

perks.name: Good   Natured
perks.description: You have a good heart. Deal 20% less damage with weapons and Destruction spells. However, while wearing an amulet of the divines beneficial spells and potions last 20% longer and you take 20% less damage.

perks.name: Hoarder
perks.description: You love carrying stuff around, even if it's junk. Gain +200 carryweight. Selling prices are 50% worse.

perks.name: Jack of   All Spells
perks.description: But master of none. Novice, Apprentice and Adept spells are 20% stronger or longer lasting, expert and master spells are 20% weaker or shorter.

perks.name: King of   Worms
perks.description: You've gained hidden insight into necromantic arts. You can have 1 additional summon or undead thrall. However, the duration of summon and resurrecting spells is reduced by 33%.

perks.name: Light   Foot
perks.description: You've never felt comfortable in footwear. When not wearing boots/shoes, your movement is muffled, you move 5% faster and suffer no fall damage. When wearing boots/shoes you move 10% slower.

perks.name: Marathon   Runner
perks.description: You regenerate 5 stamina per second while sprinting. However, you will not be able to gain any stamina while running or standing still.

perks.name: Nosferatu
perks.description: You're an ugly sight and live in the sewers. -50 speech, no health, magicka or stamina regen outdoors. Eating skeever meat gives you a 20% speed boost and restores 10 health, magicka and stamina per second for 180 seconds.

perks.name: Old   Fashioned
perks.description: If it ain't broke, don't fix it. Weapons, armor and magical staves made of iron, wood, steel, fur or hide are 15% stronger. Otherwise, they are 10% weaker.

perks.name: Pacifist
perks.description: When your arms are lowered you restore 2 magicka and stamina per second. However, raising your hands in combat will have the opposite effect. Those born under the sign of the Atronach do not gain any benefits.

perks.name: Rage
perks.description: You possess a natural fight response. When at less than 20% health, you deal 20% more damage and take 20% less damage. However, you move 30% slower when below this threshold.

perks.name: Skilled
perks.description: Reading skill books grants an extra skill point and trainers cost 50% less, however every 5 levels you don't gain a perk point.

perks.name: Soul   Reaver
perks.description: You've claimed countless souls for your gain. Weapon and armor enchantments are 10% stronger and use 10% less charge. Armor rating and weapon damage is reduced by 10%.

perks.name: Swimmer
perks.description: You prefer life on the water. In water, you swim 30% faster, can breath underwater and regenerate health, stamina and magicka by a flat 1 per second. On land, you suffer 25% less health, stamina and magicka regeneration.

perks.name: Unbound   Hands
